page.title: 13RELIGION IN STOTTESDON
page.content: A service is held in the{Church}every Sunday. Matins & Evensong with hymns are from the 1662 Prayer Book. The Communion Service is Rite A. Older members enjoy the 1662 Communion when there is a 5th Sunday in the month. Christmas, Easter & Harvest services are well attended. On Sundays about 5% of parishioners attend. Everyone joins in weddings & funerals. Tourists visit the church to see the beautiful Norman font & Saxon tympanum. The Norman tower is about to be repaired at a cost of Â£20,000. The extension of the churchyard had its first burial this year. A monthly service is held in the {Methodist}Chapel.{Catholics}go to Cleobury Mortimer or Bridgnorth. There is a{Baptist}Chapel in Chorley which several Stottesdon people attend, especially for Sunday School.
